data.title: The Great Columbia Crossing 10K
data.meta_description: The bridge run SOLD OUT on 8/10/24 at 1:00pm, a new record! This epic event, headquartered in Astoria, Oregon, gives participants once-a-year access to cross the longest continuous truss bridge in North America. The race course offers participants scenic views of the mouth of the river and marine activity below. The race will cap at…
data.text:
See the Astoria-Megler Bridge from a whole new perspective!

This epic event gives participants once-a-year access to cross the longest continuous truss bridge in North America.Â Whether youâre an experienced runner or looking for a family-friendly event, the Great Columbia Crossing 10K appeals to everyone.

The 2024 race will cap at 3,500 in-person participants and there is no waitlist. Register early to guarantee your spot.

Race Date:Â Sunday, October 13, 2024

Start Time: 8:45 a.m.

Race Start Location: Dismal Nitch Rest Area, WA All race participants are shuttledÂ by bus to the starting area before 8 a.m.

Race Finish Location: Port of Astoria, OR

Course Map: CLICK HERE

Join our email list: CLICK HERE

Our event shirts are available as an add-on to your registration. This year's shirt will be purple.

The long sleeve shirt is available in our choice ofÂ 100% cotton or polyester. Click for size charts.

Sizes are listed on the registration form and we encourage you to pre-order your shirt, as our size selection is limited on race weekend.

Design by Delfina Acfalle

Delfina is a graphic design and advertising student at Grand Canyon University. She easily found a passion for creativity and art throughout the years. She enjoys painting and exploring different mediums when it comes to being off the computer. Even though she loves her classes and major, she loves coming home to Astoria and her pets in the summer. Learn more about her here.

Congratulations to all of you who participated in 2023.Â Thank you to all of our partner agencies and volunteers who make this a GREAT event!

The 2023 race sold out at 3,500 in-person participants.

Race Date:Â Sunday, October 8, 2023Results:Â Congrats to our first place male and female finishers!

Nicholas Marty of Vader, WA (20) at 34:00.2

Bailee Krings of Forest Grove, OR (27) at 38:35.4

See full results provided by Eclectic EdgeÂ

Photos: View the photos from Evan Pilchik Photography here.

Whether a local resident or traveling from outside of the area, we encourage you to make plans to visit our local shops, galleries, restaurants and more.

Spend the CLAM BUCKS

that you get with your event registration at participating merchants during the week of the event.

What are Clam Bucks?

Clam Bucks are wooden tokens worth $1 each. They can be spent just like cash. Each participant receives 5 Clam Bucks with their race bib.

We provide an additional 5 Clam Bucks to participants who have their packet mailed or choose to pick-up their packets on Thursday, October 5, or Friday, October 6, to help us reduce crowding at packet pick-up.

When can Clam Bucks be spent?

Clam Bucks are valid for a full week, starting on the first day of race packet pick-up, Thursday, October 5.Â The final day Clam Bucks can be spent is Wednesday, October 11. (Race day is on Sunday, October 8, 2023)

Where can Clam Bucks be spent?

Clam Bucks can be spent ONLY at participating Chamber member businesses.Â Businesses will be given a sign that shows that they accept clam bucks, too.Â Limit: 5 Clam Bucks per person, per business unless business allows otherwise.Â List of participating businesses will be posted nearer to the event.

Click here to see the list of locations!

This race is a fundraiser!

The Great Columbia Crossing 10K is a fundraiser for the Astoria-Warrenton Area Chamber of Commerce, allowing us to continue hosting this event year after year.Â Additionally, the chamber gives back to the community by employing/hiring/utilizing chamber members and local businesses and by giving donations to area nonprofits in exchange for services provided during the event.

This really is a community-focused event!

Event photography provided by EP Events

CLICK HERE to browse the Great Columbia Crossing 10K race photo galleries.
